ARABIC: وَإِن تَجْهَرْ بِٱلْقَوْلِ فَإِنَّهُۥ يَعْلَمُ ٱلسِّرَّ وَأَخْفَى

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Though you speak out loud, He knows your secrets and what is even more concealed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Whether you say a thing aloud or inaudibly, He has knowledge of the secret and the hidden.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Whether you speak out aloud (or in a low voice), He knows what is said secretly, and even that which is most hidden.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Whether or not you express (your thoughts) in words, God certainly knows all unspoken thoughts and all that is even more difficult to find.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And if you speak aloud – so He surely knows the secret and that which is more concealed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And if you speak aloud, then verily, He knows the secret and that which is yet more hidden.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And if you utter the saying aloud, then surely He knows the secret, and what is yet more hidden.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Be thou loud in thy speech, yet surely He knows the secret and that yet more hidden.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And if thou speakest aloud, then lo! He knoweth the secret (thought) and (that which is yet) more hidden.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Whether you speak aloud [or in a low voice], He hears all, for He knows your secrets and what is even more hidden.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And if thou speakest the word aloud, then verily He knoweth the secret and the most hidden.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Whether you speak loudly [or in secret tones,] He indeed knows the secret and what is still more hidden.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: If thou pronounce the word aloud, (it is no matter): for verily He knoweth what is secret and what is yet more hidden.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And if you (O Muhammad SAW) speak (the invocation) aloud, then verily, He knows the secret and that which is yet more hidden.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: If you speak loudly; He has indeed knowledge of the secret and the hidden.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: If you speak aloud—He knows the secret, and the most hidden.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And if you speak aloud - then indeed, He knows the secret and what is [even] more hidden.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [20:7] And should you be loud in your speech, in remembrance [of God] or supplication, then God has no need for this to be [spoken] loud, then indeed He knows the secret and [that which is] yet more hidden, than that [secret], namely, that which the soul whispers [to itself] and that which occurs to the mind but which you do not speak of [to anyone], so do not strain yourself to be loud [in your speech].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And if thou speakest aloud) and act openly, (then Lo! He knoweth the secret (thought)) and secret action (and (that which is yet) more hidden) than that which is a secret, whether it has ensued from you or has not yet ensued from you but will in the future. Allah knows all that. 336
